intro: Nauclea longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered nauclea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and for horticultural purposes.
